mainBoard.flavorText: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.
mainBoard.name: Murk Dwellers

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something “attacks and isn’t blocked” triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

mainBoard.text: Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"
mainBoard.name: Scathe Zombies

mainBoard.flavorText: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.
mainBoard.name: Zephyr Falcon

mainBoard.flavorText: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.
mainBoard.name: Hill Giant

mainBoard.flavorText: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

foreignData.name: Orques de la Griffe de fer

mainBoard.name: Ironclaw Orcs
mainBoard.text: This creature can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

mainBoard.flavorText:
Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name—
But those who go with her are never the same.
mainBoard.name: Lost Soul
mainBoard.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.
mainBoard.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident

mainBoard.flavorText: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his Raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.
mainBoard.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
Unsummon
mainBoard.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

mainBoard.name: Terror
mainBoard.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

mainBoard.name: Twiddle

rulings.text: The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.
This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.

mainBoard.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

mainBoard.name: Disintegrate

rulings.text: Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

The “can’t regenerate” is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.

mainBoard.text: Disintegrate deals X damage to any target. If it's a creature, it can't be regenerated this turn, and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant
mainBoard.name: Pyrotechnics

rulings.text: If an effect creates a copy of Pyrotechnics, the number of targets and division of damage can’t be changed. The effect that creates the copy may allow you to change the targets, however.
If some but not all of Pyrotechnics’s targets become illegal, you can’t change the division of damage. Damage that would have been dealt to illegal targets simply isn’t dealt.
You choose how the damage is divided as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

mainBoard.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
